column2: Swatch says Tiffany to pay it $449 mln in damagesUPDATE 1-Tiffany cuts outlook after Dutch court ruling ZURICH
column3: Dec 22 Tiffany & Co on Sunday cut its full-year outlook following a Dutch court ruling that it must pay Swatch Group 402 million Swiss francs ($448.79 million) in damages.  UPDATE 1-Tiffany cuts outlook after Dutch court ruling ZURICH

column5: Dec 22 Swatch Group said a Dutch court has sentenced Tiffany & Co. to pay it 402 million Swiss francs ($448.79 million) in damages in a lawsuit following the end of a collaboration between the two groups.UPDATE 1-Tiffany cuts outlook after Dutch court ruling ZURICH

column2: Target payment card data theft highlights lagging U.S. security BOSTON
column3: Dec 22 The massive data breach disclosed by retailer Target Corp last week is likely to teach its U.S. customers a painful lesson in payment card security and build support for an anti-fraud technology now sitting on the shelf.
